Today I would like to open up a new discussion on some new ways and ideas to possibly alter the rules.

replies.body:
The rule on locking threads for bumping needs to be more clearer for all moderators.
I made a thread about it but considering you're asking for suggestions..

I see multiple moderators lock thread simply because people have bumped the thread.

Now at first, this is good but threads have been locked even though that he post in question was on topic.

Bumping threads are OK as long as the comment is on topic. Bumping threads aren't OK if the comment has nothing to do with the topic.

I have seen all types of mods (from Jr's to Sr's) lock threads that didn't need to be locked.

I think that all moderators and staff need to learn exactly what to look for before locking a thread.

Thanks.

replies.body:
What rule, specifically, do you feel could be added that can potentially help the community? 

  • To be honest, the rules seem to cover everything. The real issue is that most of them are not even enforced. Rules can change and change is good but if no one is enforcing the rules then remove the rules otherwise the entire rule page is meaningless. For example, did you know all the Kohi videos that get posted are agaisnt the rules? Mhm oh and Caps are not actually agaisnt the rules and swearing (directed at people or not) is agaisnt the rules also.
  • Just thought one of: "Bitch about other players in Teamspeak is not acceptable." Now it should probably be phrased a bit better than that but the amount of bitching I hear on teamspeak is disgusting from staff AND players... Its just negativity and has no purpose other than to make the bitches feel better about themselves because they are saying stuff behind their "friends" back and they cant defend themselves.


What rule, specifically, do you feel should be enforced more? 
The very first rule in the official rules:
  • Maintain a casual and positive atmosphere at all times. Inappropriate or aggressive language, regardless if it is directed at someone or not, will not be tolerated. Be respectful of all players. Harassment, bullying, rudeness and excessive swearing is strictly not allowed.
Too often I see it getting ignored by staff and players alike.
Also this one:
  • Ban evasion is not permitted and will result in a permanent ban on all accounts associated with the original Minecraft account.
I mean this rule is basically just not implemented at all. I am not sure if it is a case that maybe Sr.Mods+ need /ipcheck or something like that.

Example...

Newguy18_76: Woooooooooooooooohoooooooooooooooo!!!!!!!!

Now, honestly, I do think it can be used for emphasis, but only when used lightly. Liiike...doing what I just did. Three letter stretches are enough, but any more tends to get really spammy.

My suggestions (sorry for no format):
Perm ban hackers, no matter what (unless of course they weren't hacking). They hacked. They knew it was against the rules. They don't deserve a second chance, unless it was a minor hack and/or they didn't know it wasn't allowed. People know xray, fly, speed, aimbot, ect is against the rules.
Lighten up on the advertising rule: Like seriously, if they tell their friend the ip to the server, whether it be on the forums or in game, you should be allowed to say the ip, as long as you don't spam it like "EVERYONE JOIN FAKEIPTHISISJUSTANEXAMPLE.GOV". Think about it: say someone just told you an ip to kohi because they wanted to 1v1 you, you're only leaving avicus temp for like 5-10 minutes (you might join back a few times though), and the person who told you the ip gets banned. How many players is avicus losing? One; and that's the person who got banned.
